title: For Sale:  ArmaLite AR-30A1
postcontent:
Unlike the other ArmaLite rifles that I have shot, the AR-30A1 is a bolt action. The bolt is long and sturdy with dual opposing locking lugs. The separate bolt head employs a plunger-type ejector. It cocks on opening. The lockup is tight enough that it takes a good slap up with the palm to release it and a slap down after running it forward to chamber a round. Although compared to some rifles, the safety seems almost like a World War II design used on the Springfield ’03 or other rifles, but I actually like it: Flicking it to the right puts it on “safe,” and the left is “fire.” This safety locks the firing pin to the rear when applied.

Probably the first thing most shooters will notice about the AR-30A1’ is its large muzzle brake with dual baffles. I’ve shot most of the current .338 Lapua Magnum sniping rifles and have found that a muzzle brake is a necessity. This brake is screwed on using 3/4×24 threads, the standard for many suppressors.

A utilitarian aluminum chassis that is bedded using a V-block keeps weight down and enhances accuracy, as does the free-floating, 26-inch barrel. ArmaLite offers two versions of the AR-30A1, Standard and Target models, and I received the latter for testing. The Target version features an adjustable cheekrest and buttpad to help tailor the rifle to the shooter, allowing them to get the best cheekweld. The cheekpiece allows 1 inch of vertical adjustment, while the length of pull may be adjusted from 13.6 to 15.6 inches.

The KSG weighs 6.9lbs and is as compact as legally possible with a 26.1" overall length and an 18.5" cylinder bore barrel. Even with this compact size, the internal dual tube magazines hold an impressive 14 rounds of 12 gauge 2-3/4" rounds (7 per tube). The simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard. The lever can be positioned in the center detent in order to easily clear the chamber without feeding another round from either magazine. A cross bolt style safety blocks the sear, and the pump release lever is located in front of the trigger guard.The pump includes an under Picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, or a light or laser. The included top Picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil. title: For Sale/Trade:  Carcano M1891 Cavalry Carbine
postcontent:
Up for sale is a Carcano M1891 Cavalry Carbine produced by the Gardone Factory in 1937.  To fully load the Carcano the Enbloc clips are needed. So to add to the rifle, I will be throwing in 5 vintage boxes of Italian made 6.5x52 ammo. Each box contains 18 rounds and 3 enbloc clips (except one with 16 rounds and 4 clips) totaling for 88 rounds and 16 enbloc clips. These rounds are the correct match for the rifle and will shoot accurately through it. Carcano's overall have a bad rep of being inaccurate, but this comes from use of incorrect ammo, such as Privi's 6.5 chambered ammo. 

If you would like to see pictures of anything or have any questions or concerns,  please feel free to ask. This rifle alone is a great piece to any collection, and even nicer with the addition of the ammo. If you offer something worth more in a trade, I may be willing to add cash or more ammo to make up the difference.

title: For Sale:  Rifle Case Saddle Scabbard
postcontent: Very heavy duty with thick fleece interior protection/padding.  Used in Wyoming when I was hunting by horseback in the mountains and in excellent ++ condition.  Blaze orange to help prevent a hunter from mistaking you and your horse for an elk--don't laugh, it happens.  It is called a rifle saddle scabbard by Cabelas I bought new in the 90s and can be partly unzipped to use it scabbard style.  It is made in USA, with thick shearling wool style full lining (synthetic I guess but durable and provides a thick protection cushion unlike neoprene or other rubberized stuff that wears and tears) Allen brand heavy ballistic cordura outer with end hanging loop, double built-in carrying straps, heavy chromed steel D rings, original separate nylon buckle straps for attaching to saddle fixings, velcro closure-rifle retainer straps at butt end when using with butt end unzipped scabbard style, and built in semi hard rubberized muzzle boot for extra protection of the rifle muzzle.  Very well taken care of.  Used but never abused.  No snags, rips, tears, repairs or rub wear.  If you horse hunt then this is one of the best saddle scabbard cases made--NOT CHINESE manufacture.  The custom leather ones that will rub blue off of and/or tarnish or rust your gun run $170 unlined to $200 lined and will no way protect your fine rifle like this Allen scabbard/case will.  Check me and see on that.  Of course it is just as easily used without the straps as a very well padded carry along rifle case.  It also fit every rifle I ever put in it scoped or not from a little .280 Rem A-Bolt Micro Browning to my monster 8mm Mag Custom shop Rem.  Email to w v spark at gmail dot com.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Carcano M1891 Cavalry Carbine
postcontent:
Up for sale is a Carcano M1891 Cavalry Carbine produced by the Gardone Factory in 1937. This rifle is in very good condition for its age and what many of these rifles went through. Like usual with these rifles, there are no import marks. These rifles are much harder to come by than the m38's and are more desirable due to the adjustable sights. Both models M38's and M1891's come with attached bayonets.

This Carbine like all others produced before the M38 model is chambered in 6.5x52 Carcano. To fully load the Carcano the Enbloc clips are needed. These clips hold 6 rounds. So to add to the rifle, I will be throwing in 5 vintage boxes of Italian made 6.5x52 ammo. Each box contains 18 rounds and 3 enbloc clips (except one with 16 rounds and 4 clips) totalling for 88 rounds and 16 enbloc clips. These rounds are the correct match for the rifle and will shoot accurately through it. Carcano's overall have a bad rep of being inaccurate, but this comes from use of incorrect ammo, such as Privi's 6.5 chambered ammo. 

If you would like to see pictures of anything or have any questions or concerns, please feel free to ask. This rifle alone is a great piece to any collection, and even nicer with the addition of the ammo. I'm asking only $500 cash value or $550 trade value. If you offer something worth more in a trade, I may be willing to add cash or more ammo to make up the difference.

postcontent:
Brand new Golight HELIOS 3320 for sale. This vehicle mounted(aircraft or large truck) imaging system will add serious thermal capability to any large truck or aircraft. It features remote rotation & tilt along with the industry standard FLIR chipset and optical system. This system includes everything needed to add thermal capability to any vehicle!!

The retail is $6995 and you cannot find this system for less!
$3,700 FIRM

The HELIOS 3320 is a low cost, high resolution thermal imaging system that allows the user to see in total darkness. Utilizing a 320 x 240 resolution FLIR Camera the system can easily see man sized targets from over 1500 feet. The thermal core uses long infrared sensor technology and can easily see through smoke, fog, rain and many other atmospheric conditions that could not easily be penetrated with other technologies. The HELIOS features remote positioning, offering 370 rotation and 135 tilt. The units are available with either a joystick style wired remote or a wireless remote package. The RF wireless remote controls can be programmed to your desired frequency for uninterrupted use with one or multiple systems. The HELIOS is easily mounted using an innovative mounting plate with under-locking interface, a simple two step mounting process. The pan/tilt enclosure uses high torque motors with encased metal gears for years of trouble free operation. Quick detach cables allow for easy removal from the vehicle in minutes. The HELIOS is composed of a weatherproof housing that is UV Ray and saltwater resistant for both land and sea applications. The entire system operates on a 12v DC platform and is ideally suited for vehicles and watercraft. Whether used for Law Enforcement, First Responders or Surveillance and Security applications, the HELIOS is the product of choice based on price and performance.

Thermal Detector • 320x240 VOx microbolometer

Construction Details • Waterproof and dustproof construction

• Diamond Like Carbon coated objective
• 50 oz weight, 10.3" length

The 30Hz ThOR 320 9x Thermal Weapon Sight from ATN is a multi-purpose thermal imaging device equipped for intermediate to long-range targeting and observation. By analyzing the heat signature of a visual scene, this scope is capable of seeing through fog, dust, daylight, and darkness to reveal subjects of interest where the naked eye sees none. This thermal imager can be weapon mounted for tactical engagement as well as tripod mounted and handheld for patrol and reconnaissance missions. When it comes to covert operations, the ThOR gives a tactical professional the advantage over a subject in their crosshairs.
A 320x240 microbolometer sits at the core of the ThOR imaging system. This heat sensor has 50mK sensitivity, capable of distinguishing subtle temperature differences and creating well-defined thermal images. An RCA video port allows the transmitted image to be outputted at full-resolution to video monitors and recording devices. The detector's 30Hz refresh rate delivers near-real time images that are ideal for intelligence gathering and essential for long-range target engagement.

The 9x configuration of the ThOR transmits a 3x2.4° angle of view. For a closer look, digital zoom can magnify the visual scene by 2x or 4x. For a better view of the displayed image, this electro-optic has image enhancement tools, including brightness adjustment and multiple polarity modes. The five polarity modes allow the operator to designate white-hot, black-hot, or even transpose the heat signature into a false-color image. Additionally, the shooter can select from five reticle patterns and five reticle colors to customize the sight for their task.

In addition to the optical features and functionality, the ThOR thermal scope is built to handle the rigors of the battlefield. The waterproof scope housing is constructed of aerospace aluminum and anodized with a type III hard coat that resists corrosion and scratching. Using the included quick-release Picatinny mount, this optic is ready to endure the recoil force of heavy caliber ammo. The built-in OLED color display, accessory side rail, and comfortable 28mm eye relief complement this scope's range of features, and help make the ThOR a fully-loaded thermal optic for tactical engagement, threat detection and intelligence gathering.


Note! Export of this device described herein is strictly prohibited without a valid export license issued by the U.S. Department of State office of Defense Trade Controls, as prescribed in the International Traffic in Arms Regulation (ITAR), Title 22, Code of Federal Regulation, Parts 120-130, and/or the U.S. Department of Commerce. For further information contact the Office of Defense Trade Control and/or the U.S. Department of Commerce.

title: For Sale/Trade:  TAC CON 3MR 3RD MODE TRIGGER
postcontent:
I just got this trigger on the 24th. 
I really like it's high rate of fire. But I realized it's not what I need for my style of shooting. I do like the fast bump reset auto feel. 
 I paid $400 (I got a great deal) they are usually $500
  will sell $375 firm. 
Kc
REDACTED

The Tac-Con 3MR Trigger System is the latest trend for gun enthusiasts that want selectable firing from their AR-15. This drop in system is a three-mode model. The first position is “Safe” as it is in all of the ARs. The 2nd mode converts the gun into semi-automatic mode which contains a single stage, 4.5 pound pull, match grade. The 3rd is TAC CON patented single stage, 4.5 pound pull, with almost no take up and contains a positive reset feature that reduces the time between shoots. The 3rd mode is a balance between a higher rate of fire with controllability.

Once installed, the 3MR will allow the shooter to reach higher rates of fire without compromising accuracy. Different tests have been performed at different gun ranges with test subjects reporting much higher rates of fire then they could with the original trigger group when engaged in the 3rd mode. It is the method in which the device is designed that allows for such rapid fire in such a smooth manner. Because of the design, however, it is not considered a fully automatic part and is 100 percent BATFE classified as a semi-automatic AR 15 trigger.

With a variety of configurations from the standard Ranch Rifle, to the extremely accurate Mini-14® Target Rifle, to the Tactical models with collapsible stock or compact barrel with flash suppressor - there is a Mini-14 or Mini Thirty to meet any demand. Specifically designed for mounting today's scopes or other optical sighting systems, these rifles include a side ejection to clear the top mounted scope, and a patented recoil buffer which protects the scope from damage or shifting the point of impact as the semi-automatic action cycles.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Browning A-Bolt Target 300 Win Mag (UPDATED)
postcontent:
This is a superb condition 2012 model 300 Win Mag Browning A-Bolt Target with a 28" bull barrel and Ross Brake muzzle brake custom for this rifle. It as less that 50 rounds through it. The barrel was cleaned after every third round to help with the break in. The scope and rings DO NOT come with the rifle for this price. Also, There is also a Browning sling with the gun.

People have asked if this gun was accurate, so I decided to go and shot the gun to show how accurate it can get. I have attached a target that I shot on 1/4/2015. I loaded IMR 4350 at 72.5 gr. using Sierra GameKing 165 gr. HPBT, and the bullet was set at 3.389 due to box length max's 3.390. The target was at 100 yards. As you can see I shot a 5 shot group for testing and I had 1 pull. The other 4 you can cover the holes with a quarter. 

If you are interested in the scope it is a Vortex 30mm - 6.5-20 x 50 Viper and will be an additional $600.

Technical specs:
Calibers: 9mm Luger

The Kel- Tec P-11 is compact and lightweight, thanks to its locked breech. Its ergonometry, perceived recoil and practical accuracy are comparable to much larger guns. The P-11 is especially well suited for plain-clothes police officers, security personnel, or as a secondary weapon for military service members. 

The P-11 has six main component groups: barrel, slide, frame, firing mechanism, grip, and magazine. The barrel is made of SAE 4140 Ordnance steel heat treated to 47 HRC. The slide is also 4140 steel, and contains the firing pin and the extractor. The rectangular frame is machined from solid 7075-T6 aluminum and houses the firing mechanism. The trigger connects via a transfer bar to the hammer and operates in Double Action Only. The hammer is driven by a novel free floating extension spring. The light weight firing pin transmits the energy of the hammer to ignite the primer. The functioning of the mechanism surpasses all applicable SAAMI safety standards. The grip is made of the ultra high impact polymer DuPont ST-8018. The grip also forms the magazine well and the trigger guard. Normally supplied with a 10-round double column all steel magazine.

title: Want To Buy:  Saiga-12 conversion needed ... I'll get the parts together if you can do the work?
postcontent:
Title pretty much says it all ... I am interested in a conversion service for a Saiga-12 shotgun.  I bought mine in NJ and couldn't have it converted due to the fact that NJ law prohibits autoloading shotguns from having a pistol grip.

I want to touch on this- as I had tried to discuss with a gunsmith, who actually was completely wrong regarding the law.  The Saiga-12 is completely and totally legal to be "converted" to a pistol-grip and AK/AR/Skeleton shoulder stock .. because in fact it is not a CONVERSION, it's a RESTORATION.  They are factory made with that configuration in mind - but due to the USA importation laws, the guns are then "sporterized" by the factory, which involves the installation of a standard shotgun/rifle shoulder stock.  However, this move requires the trigger group be transitioned back an inch or two, as the fire control group could not be accessed when gripping a shoulder-stock grip.

The "Conversion" process is in fact a restoration - the fire control group moves forward to it's intended (original ) location, a pistol grip and shoulder stock installed, and you're good to go.  The legality comes in on the "922R" laws, which are importation codes requiring an imported gun to have a certain amount of American-made parts post modifications.  I am very familiar with these laws and not intending to break any, but a gunsmith wouldn't help me because he didn't understand these laws.  I am just not comfortable doing this work myself as I don't have the tools and haven't done it before, so I need to hire someone (who is very good and familiar at this area of expertise).

I can buy all the parts needed and simply pay you for the job, if you're capable and interested please message me back.  I could also pay in ammo if you like.  We can discuss the compensation to mutual satisfaction.  Thanks much for listening and hopefully contacting me!
